post.description:
Creating the CSV file for assets.
Parameters are:
  • assets: Array of asset ids
  • columns: Describes the columns that should be exported. Can be obtained via the grid endpoint
  • config: Delimiter and header options
Delimiter can be set to anything, but the default is a semicolon
Header options are: no_header, title and name
Download has to be triggered separately via the csv download route with the {jobRunId} returned in the response

default.description:
400 - Bad Request
401 - Unauthorized
404 - Not Found
405 - Method Not Allowed
415 - Unsupported Media Type
422 - Unprocessable Content

post.summary: Creating CSV file for assets based on folder
post.description:
Creating the CSV file for assets based on the folder.
Parameters are:
  • folders: Array of folder ids
  • columns: Describes the columns that should be exported. Can be obtained via the grid endpoint. For folders you can also use filters and sorting
  • filters: Filter assets from folder based on the grid filter schema
  • config: Delimiter and header options
Delimiter can be set to anything, but the default is a semicolon
Header options are: no_header, title and name
Download has to be triggered separately via the csv download route with the {jobRunId} returned in the response

default.description:
400 - Bad Request
401 - Unauthorized
404 - Not Found
405 - Method Not Allowed
415 - Unsupported Media Type
422 - Unprocessable Content

post.description:
Creating a ZIP file for assets based on the provided asset IDs in {assets} parameter.
Download has to be triggered separately via the zip download route with the {jobRunId} returned in the response

put.description:
Update needs to have the complete data present.
You can create/update/delete list entries like metadata, custom settings and properties.
E.g. if you want to remove an entry from metadata simply do not include this entry in the update.
If you want to update only a single field, use the PATCH method.

default.description:

401 - Unauthorized
404 - Not Found
405 - Method Not Allowed
415 - Unsupported Media Type
422 - Unprocessable Content

patch.description:
Patching assets based on the given ID and data.
Patching can be used for updating single or multiple fields.
If single element is being patched, operation is executed synchronously. Multiple elements are patched asynchronously.

201.description: Successfully created jobRun for patching multiple assets

default.description:
400 - Bad Request
401 - Unauthorized
404 - Not Found
405 - Method Not Allowed
415 - Unsupported Media Type
422 - Unprocessable Content

patch.summary: Patch all assets based on folder ID and filters
patch.description:
Patching assets based on the given folder ID and data.
Patching on folders will be done asynchronously.
You can also use filters and sorting. Filter assets from folder based on the grid filter schema

201.description: Successfully created jobRun for patching multiple assets

default.description:
400 - Bad Request
401 - Unauthorized
404 - Not Found
405 - Method Not Allowed
415 - Unsupported Media Type
422 - Unprocessable Content

get.summary: Get all asset data for the tree
get.description:
Listing of all assets and asset folders in the system.
Returns only data which are relevant for the tree
You can use different query parameters to filter the assets and it is possible to exclude folders from the result completely

parameters.name: idSearchTerm
parameters.description: Filter assets/data-objects by matching ids. As a wildcard * can be used

parameters.name: pathIncludeParent
parameters.description: Include the parent item in the result.

parameters.name: pathIncludeDescendants
parameters.description: Include all descendants in the result.

default.description:
400 - Bad Request
401 - Unauthorized
404 - Not Found
405 - Method Not Allowed
415 - Unsupported Media Type
422 - Unprocessable Content

delete.summary: Delete a specific element and its children
delete.description:
Deletes a specific element based on the given {elementType} and {id}.
The {id} must be an existing element of the provided {elementType}.
If element is a folder, all child elements will be deleted as well. Elements are moved into the Recycle Bin before deletion.

parameters.name: elementType
parameters.description: Filter elements by matching element type.

201.description: Successfully created jobRun for deleting element and its children

default.description:
400 - Bad Request
401 - Unauthorized
404 - Not Found
405 - Method Not Allowed
415 - Unsupported Media Type
422 - Unprocessable Content

parameters.description: Filter elements by matching element type.

parameters.name: sortBy
parameters.description: Sort by field. Only works in combination with sortOrder.

parameters.name: fieldFilters
parameters.description:
Filter for specific fields, will be json decoded to an array. e.g.
            [{"operator":"like","value":"John","field":"name","type":"string"}]

400 - Bad Request

405 - Method Not Allowed
415 - Unsupported Media Type
422 - Unprocessable Content

post.description:
Get all paginated notifications for current user.
You can specify different filters in your request body. Available filters are:
  • title: Filter by title string
  • creationDate: Filter by creation date (on, from, to)
  • page: Used for offset calculation in pagination. To be used, needs to be defined together with the page.size
  • page.size: Used for limiting the result numbers per page. To be used, needs to be defined together with the page

get.summary: Get all predefined properties. You can filter by type and query
get.description:
Listing all the predefined properties that are currently stored in the system.
To list specific properties for a type you can use the elementType query parameter.
You can also created element type specific listings for this, to show in the context of the element.
The filter query parameter is applied on the name of the property.
Keep in mind that the name is language specific.
